H0.text: Photosynthesis is the process by which plant-like protists containing chloroplasts make food.

H1.text: Digestion is the process by which plant‑like protists that contain chloroplasts make food.

H2.text: Chemical processes are how plant‑like protists that contain chloroplasts make food.

H3.text: Farming is the process by which plant‑like protists that contain chloroplasts make food.

A4.text: Autotrophic protists synthesize their own organic compounds from inorganic substrates through the process of photosynthesis, using light as the source of energy.

A5.text: Endocytosis is considered one of the most important adaptations in the origin of eukaryotes because it increased the potential food supply, and phagocytosis allowed the endosymbiosis and development of mitochondria and chloroplasts.
